Eleven year old Izuku stood as still as he could as the man in front of him rambled. He could barely hear the garbage he was spouting about ‘no heroes coming to save him’ over the pounding in his chest. Thankfully, or maybe not, the thump of footsteps makes both of them pause for a moment. They both turned to see a hero (was that Endeavor?!?) walking past the alley entrance. 
 
“Help! There’s a guy trying to mug me!” Midoriya shouted in a desperate attempt at not getting injured. The man started to shake in fear and ran off, tipping over trash cans as he ran from the scene. Izuku took his hint and ran as well, to where he last saw the hero, only stopping to catch his breath. As soon as he could breathe again he grabbed the hero’s arm- not a great idea, he did have flames rippling over him- and started bowing. Endeavor turned to look at him with distaste in his eyes. 
 
“Mr. Endeavor sir there was a man- and he- there was a knife- and he was asking for my money- and he got away, but I lost what I had on me. And I really needed that money to get groceries for my mom. Please help me, sir.” He added on the sir as an afterthought. However, it didn’t do much good, for the tall hero turned around and continued to walk. Izuku stared at him, confused, as the flame “hero” walked away. Seeing the departing figure Midoriya tried again, a little more forcefully than he had intended. 
 
“Please sir I was just mugged. You’re a hero aren’t you? You’re supposed to do something.” 
 
Now, Midoriya couldn’t see Endeavore’s face, but he could almost feel the hero’s annoyance. “I don’t have time to deal with some stupid mugging. If I walked around handling all the back alley shit that happens all day I’d be no better than some worthless sidekick; I’d never become the number one hero. Go find someone who cares.” He turned and stormed off leaving the young child dumbfounded in his wake. As he watched the flame hero exit his vision, Midoriya slowly sunk down onto the pavement and tears dripped from his eyes.
 
How could he not care? Heros are supposed to be the ones who help people. If my teachers won’t care what kids are doing in school, the heros won’t help outside of school, and mom won’t notice anything wrong then who am I supposed to turn to? I mean it seems like the only person who cares about me is me! Midoriya laughed, but it was dry and mocking. Then his eyes got wide and he smiled. That’s it! I have to be the one to help. I don’t have a quirk so it’s not like I can go vigilante, but I’ll figure something out. Then the smile grew dangerous. And first I’ll figure out how to get that mugger in jail.
 
With that thought in mind, he walked home with a new pep in his step and a light in his eyes that hadn’t shown in years.
____
 
When Midoriya got home he plopped down on his bed and began to search for any evidence he could against his attacker. He soon realized though that, while there were cameras in the alley, he wouldn’t be able to reach them without either permission or hacking. 
 
God, it’s like they don’t want people to get condemned. Sighing, Midoriya turned to the internet to see if there were any other options, because, when in doubt, turn to Google. Oh hey, free online coding and hacking classes, that could work! Seems sketchy, but I don’t have any other options at the moment.
 
The eleven year old leaned back, satisfied with this achievement. It was his first step, kind of, towards his end goal. Even if it had only been a Google search and finding some online classes, it was still more than he had ever done before. Pride rippled through him and Midoriya smiled to himself. Soon, soon I’ll bring that man to justice. I hope.
 
It wasn’t until he heard his mother open the door that he remembered the reason he needed to do this in the first place. He scrambled downstairs to see the short, plump woman hanging up her coat. 
 
“Hi honey how was your day at school?” She said as she grabbed Midoriya in a large, warm hug. “You remembered to go shopping right?”
 
“Actually, there was an issue. So, you see, I was going to, but then this guy stoppedmeandhehadaknifeandhetookthemoneyandItriedtogeta herotostophimbuthedidn’tandtheguygotawayand-” He stopped as he felt his mom’s shaking hands on his shoulders.
 
“Oh my gosh you were mugged! Are you okay baby?!” The woman began to cry as she embraced him again and began petting his hair. “Oh don’t you worry about the groceries we can go together tomorrow. It’ll be alright. Now tell me what happened.”
____
 
The next big change didn’t happen until a couple weeks later. Izuku was walking home from school again when he heard crying from the alley across the street. Carefully he slipped inside and walked toward the source. 
 
“A villainous piece of shit like you? You’d be better off in a prison then as a doctor. It’s almost naive that you think a quirk that can take people apart isn’t perfect for a villain like you.” It sounded to him like a highschooler. Peaking around the corner of a dumpster he could see two kids in what he thought were the uniforms of middle school third years, one year younger than what he originally thought. The taller of the two was leaning over a shorter kid who had fallen to the ground against the dirty alley wall. 
 
“But what if someone needs surgery, or an amputation, and I could help!” The smaller boy retorted. Izuku could see his hands shaking from where he stood a few meters away.
 
“Ha! Yeah right! You’d probably screw up and get them killed like the worthless fuck-up you are.” The younger kid, or at least he looked younger, curled in on himself. Satisfied, the bullies walked away down the other end of the alley, laughing. Deciding that now would be the best time, Izuku stepped out of his hiding spot and began to walk over to help up the still shaking boy. 
 
“Hey are you alright? Man that guy was an ass. I know someone just like him, and let me tell you he’s the worst!” The older boy gave him a look of bewilderment before giving a small laugh and nodding.
 
“Yeah that guy is the worst too; he broke my phone yesterday too.”
 
“Ah that sucks, I would have asked to trade numbers.” Izuku said in the most caring voice he could. “By the way what you said about your quirk was really spot on. It would be really good for a surgeon or even an EMT. Does it work selectively or does it only remove the entire object? Because if it was selective you could even use your quirk to remove tumors! Or take out bullets! Oh my god that’s such a cool quirk!” He almost started one of his muttering tangents but stopped at the look on that guy’s face.
 
“I- it does work selectively!” The kid was looking at Izuku like he hung the stars in the sky, “And wow, that’s a lot of ideas. I’ve never even thought about my quirk that way and trust me I’ve thought about it a lot. What’s your quirk, analysis?”
 
“Well, funny you say that…” Midoriya rubbed the back of his head nervously. “I don’t have a quirk.”
 
“Oh, um, cool.” Suddenly, his face turns into one of pity and awkwardness. “So, yeah. Thanks, I guess. Anyways, see you around.” The middle schooler picked up his stuff, dusted himself off, and started jogging down the alley away from Midoriya.
 
Wow. He forgot how much that hurt. Everyone at his school knew he was quirkless so he hadn't gotten that kind of reaction in a while. Ugh. Midoriya kicked the ground under his worn shoes and stared towards the sky. Well, dinner won’t make itself and I’m in charge of it tonight. Gotta get home.
 
Still, during the final minutes of the walk home, Midoriya couldn’t figure out which hurt more: the kid’s reaction, or the fact that it was so normal he was able to just brush it off. However, he did know that it would be the last time anyone would get away with anything without him knowing about it. And without the police knowing about it, because Midoriya wasn’t about to be walking around beating heads in. No, Midoriya grinned, he’d let the police do that.

Three years later

“Okay,” Midoriya stretched his hands over his head and felt his back pop, “this is gonna take a while.” He pushed away his computer and brought his notebook towards him. “So, first up is the villain Ground Breaker. He was last seen in these coordinates, which is a bar. Welp, I guess he’s an idiot, but I mean, it helps me a lot. So, if I hack into this camera, then I can see when he leaves and where he goes.” Midoriya smiled and switched his notebook for his computer. He brought up his version of the city map and looked for the camera nearest to the bar. Camera 5623. An easy enough one to hack. Once Ground Breaker left the bar, Midoriya slowly followed the villain’s path using the cameras- in a totally legal way- up until he entered an abandoned warehouse. The villain didn’t leave the building for the rest of the night.
 
“Ugh,” Izuku slithered from his chair and collapsed onto the floor, “that took a while. Yeesh, what time is it?” He turned his head slightly to allow for the bright red light of his alarm clock to assault his eyes; it was blinking a simple 4:21 am. “Dangit, I missed 4:20. I’m an embarrassment, a disgrace, and I really should message the others about this soon.”

Two hands slammed onto Midoriya’s desk and startled him awake. He almost kept pretending to be asleep anyway, but then he smelled the smoke. He whipped his head up and stared into the crimson eyes of Bakabitch Katsuki.
 
“Um, hi. Kacchan. Fancy seeing you here.” Midoriya cringed internally. That was not a good idea, but nothing is ever a good idea when Bakugou is around.
 
Bright light flashed from underneath Bakugou’s palms and Midoriya flinched away. “Fancy seeing you here,” Bakugou snarled in a bad imitation of Midoriya’s voice, “You think you can make fun of me? Especially after ignoring me?”
 
“No, I didn’t mean to say that--wait, when did I ignore you?” Oops. That was the wrong thing to say. Anger sparked in Kacchan’s eyes and he leaned closer.
 
“Sleeping in class like you’re better than the rest of us. Ha. Like a quirkless freak could ever be better than me.” The heat from Bakugou’s explosions almost burned Midoriya’s skin and he tried to back away, which is easier said than done when one is in a chair. Said chair then tipped over and Midoriya’s head slammed into the ground. He scrambled out of it and stood up with the grace of a baby fawn.
 
“So, you see, I didn’t mean to fall asleep. It was an accident. I just stayed up too late last night and yeah. So, um, can you ever find it in your heart to forgive me?” As soon as Midoriya realized what he just said he freezed.
 

Oh god. This is going to be the day that I die. I just talked back to Kacchan. I’m doomed. Poor Easerhead and Tsukauchi, they’ll never know who I am. I’ll never get to 100,000 people. I’m too young to die! I have too much to live for!

 
Thankfully, no more words were exchanged. Bakugou just used his signature glare and quirk to escalate the situation, and once it was smokey enough, he left. Actually, Midoriya thinks while walking home and looking down at his burnt uniform and skin, I might have prefered if there was more talking and less burning. His backpack was chafing on one of the worst burns and the pain was getting to the point where he couldn’t ignore it anymore. Thankfully, he had already made it to the park and was able to find a secluded area.
 
Once he got there Midoriya quickly sat down and took off his backpack. Then, he took out his mini first aid kit and applied the burn cream to his shoulder. The relief was immediate. Thank God for quality burn crea-what the fuck!
 
The thing responsible for surprising Midoriya was a boy, around Izuku’s age, running full speed into his hiding spot. The middle schooler then proceeded to trip over Midorya’s outstretched legs and fall flat on his face.
 
“Oh my god are you okay?” The fallen boy had a uniform that Midoriya had never seen before, and purple hair. He, honestly, looked to be dead. This just in, Apparition killed an innocent boy. The entire police force is coming together to find this criminal-
 
A groan stopped the greenette’s internal monologue and he looked down to see the boy was slowly getting up. The middle schooler didn’t look very injured, besides from a bump on his head, so Midoriya breathed a sigh of relief. He was about to ask the boy’s name when shouts came from the same direction he had come from. The kid’s expression soon turned to fear and Midoriya, who had had that exact expression many times, could guess who was chasing him. A lightbulb went off in his head, and Izuku quickly climbed one of the trees, took his phone out, and started recording.
 
Three new boys came into the clearing cracking their knuckles and smirking. In their hands they held a muzzle.
 
“Did you think you could run from us, villain?” The purplette shook his head and opened his mouth to defend himself. “Shit, he’s gonna talk! Quickly!” The two other boys jumped on their victim and wrestled him to the ground. Their leader quickly walked over to the struggling boy and put the muzzle on his head. “There, now you can’t brainwash anyone. Man, feels good to be a hero doesn’t it guys,” His two lackeys nodded.
 
Satisfied, they walked away and left the boy curled in a ball, tears falling from his tired, sunken eyes . Midoriya took that as his que to stop recording and climb down.
 
“Hey,” a flinch, “it’s okay. I’m a friend. Can I take that muzzle off?” A nod. Midoriya quickly put on the gloves he kept with him and bent down. Once he had taken the muzzle off he then put the offending object in a police evidence bag and stuffed it in his backpack. Can never be too careful. “Um, what’s your name?”
 
“Shinso Hitoshi.” Sarcasm leaked into his voice and Midoriya wondered if that meant he was lying or was a coping mechanism.
 
“Cool. Hi Shinso, I’m Midoriya Izuku. Are you hurt? I have a first aid kit in my bag for when things like this happen to me.”
 
At that last sentence Shinso looked up wide eyed. He paused a moment, taking in the various burns on the shorter boy. After a moment, his inner turmoil seemed to die down and he spoke.
 
“Thank you, Midoriya, but I think I’ll be okay. And anyways, I don’t think a first aid kit is going to be enough for those injuries. You should go to a hospital!” His eyes were filled with concern and no sarcasm was found. Apparently fellow bullied students get a free pass.
 
“Heh, no, I’m good. I have top class burn cream in it so I’ll be good. Although, I’ll need to get a new uniform, but this is why you order spares!” When Shinso looked ready to argue Izuku decided it was time to get back on his walk. “I’ll, um, see you around? Hopefully?” Midoriya started walking away and then said one more comment. “And don’t worry. Things will get better.”
 
Leaving the confused boy behind him, the burnt middle schooler started jogging back to his house, carrying his backpack in his hand instead of over his shoulders. As soon as he got home, Midoriya yelled a quick “I’m home” and raced to his room. Shinso Hitoshi. Now that I know his name I can find his school and hack into the cams. Maybe I’ll get his number while I’m at it and text him? Midoriya cracked his knuckles and began.
 
Two hours later, he had about an hour's worth of footage of poor Shinso being bullied. The footage also shows the teachers not doing anything, or helping it along. Izuku compiled it all, including the recording he got in the park, and put in on his flash drive. This specific flash drive was decorated so it has a smiley face on one side and a ghost on the other. Midoriya also added some general info like names so that Tsukauchi can deal with it faster. He then put on some dark clothes, got out the bag with the muzzle, and told his mom that he was going on a walk.
 
The walk to the police station is pretty quiet, so Midoriya spent the time hacking their cameras. Well, the one in Tsukauchi’s office. Once he got there, the greenette walked to the side of the building and checked the camera to make sure no one’s inside that room. There wasn’t. Perfect. Then, a click of a button and the camera is looped.
 
Midoriya walked over to his favorite police officer’s office window, and quickly peeked in. Still no one there. Then, he fiddled with the window lock a bit and slid the window up. Jeez, it took me forever to figure out how to deal with that lock. Like bitch, what the fuck. That bitchass window lock stopped me for a fucking month! I had to enter through the vents! Fuck no, never again. Once he got into his office, Midoriya placed the muzzle and the flash drive on his desk and made a speedy escape, unlooping the camera once he was off the premises.

The next morning Midoriya woke up to a whole eight hours of sleep. He usually didn’t stop until he had arrested at least two people, but he had already done that with Shinso. That was how he got over 86,000 arrests in only three years. That, and villains like to be in groups. Safety in numbers I guess.
 
An hour later, Midoriya had already made himself breakfast, gotten dressed, gotten a lead, and was walking to school. He had his phone out and was investigating a new criminal. Their name was Cameleon and they could change their entire appearance to fit their needs. It made them a pain to try and follow. But Midoriya had figured out their most used appearance and was now looking into that person’s information.
 
School started before Izuku could figure out anything super useful, but that didn’t really matter. Midoriya’s school was pretty average academically, so the classes were a breeze. All he had to do was start investigating on his computer instead of his phone.
 
It was during the lunch break that Midoriya finally found a clue. Chameleon's main persona’s name was Nakamoto Takashi and went to school at … UA?? Oh shit. A villain got into UA? This could get bad. With new fervor Midoriya tried to get as much evidence as he could that Nakamoto and Chameleon were the same person. Time passed in a flash and soon school had ended. Still, during all that time, there was a piece missing. Midoriya’s research was enough that anyone with a brain could figure out that his suspect and Chameleon were one and the same, but it wasn’t enough to get the civilian version of the criminal in jail and make him stay there.
 
Que the muttering tangent: “Okay, so look at all the times when Chameleon went and wreaked havoc,” Midoriya paused as he scrolled through different newspapers. “Wait, what’s that. He robbed a store with a bunch of other villains at noon. On a Tuesday! That’s during school! Which means that I might be able to get footage of him leaving UA or transforming into something using Chameleon’s quirk! So all I have to do is hack into UA’s cameras! Wait, shit.
